title: Dixon's Chimney rescue operation as man dangles from 270ft structure
text:
A man has been left dangling upside-down from the top of a 270ft chimney for more than six hours as the emergency services deployed a helicopter in an attempt to rescue him.

Police, fire and ambulance have been scrambled to the scene, with a helicopter hovering near the top of Dixon's Chimney in Carlisle, Cumbria.

Footage from the scene appears to show a figure, upside down with his legs in the air, at the top of the chimney.

Locals reported the rescue operation was launched at around 2.50am on Monday. Roads around the structure, built in 1836 and a prominent local landmark, have been closed.

Witnesses said shouts and wailing could be heard coming from the chimney in the early hours of this morning before police arrived on the scene, according to local reports.

He is said to be dangling by his clothes.
description: A man has been left dangling upside-down from the top of a 270ft chimney for more than six hours as the emergency services deployed a helicopter in an attempt to rescue him.
